label: CORE
info:
The **tuyaDAEMON CORE** handles the LOW-LEVEL MQTT communications with devices, via tuyapi, offering you a bidirectional integration with 'real' and 'virtual' Tuya devices. Version 2.2.2 see: https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON
see: https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaDAEMON ### Installation see [github documentation](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaDAEMON#installation) ### Configuration Update the node: `'global CORE config'`: follow the node documentation.

label: core_SYSTEM
info:
Since ver. 2.0 '_sistem' is implemented as a 'fake SW device. ### Features - a 'proxy' command to manage communications between multiple instances of tuyaDEAMON on lan. - a centralized information point about tuyaDAEMON and the status of the devices, especially useful in security applications. - 'clean' access to tuyaDAEMON and host PC resources, for automation projects, like messages, beep, voice, timer, exec, etc. - SYSTEM extends the capability to implement customized automation task using only 'share' structure (example: _beep_loop2 implementation). For more information
see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system ### Installation see [github documentation](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaDAEMON#installation) ### Configuration User must update the node: `'global SYSTEM config'`: follow the node documentation.

label: core_TRIGGER
info:
A 'real' device WiFI, having  a big unused numerical parameter, say a 'counter', writable by both **Tuya-cloud** and **node-red**, is all the required hardware to implement a robust bilateral event communication (**TRIGGER**).

see: https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaTRIGGER/README.md

### Advantages
 *   Bilateral communication between any Tuya device and tuyaDAEMON  (also for devices not compatible with 'tuya-smart-device'  node. e.g. WiFI alarms).
 *   Capability to fire any Tuya 'automation' from tuyaDAEMON, and viceversa, to control from tuya-cloud any application and custom device handled by TuyaDAEMON.
 *   Remote control (wordwide) of tuyaDAEMON.

### more properties
This flow add, to native capabilies of the used switch ([switch-1CH](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/blob/main/devices/switch-1CH/device_switch-1CH.pdf)):

_tstPing: to measure the TRIGGER roundtrip time, [see here](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaTRIGGER-info#tuyadaemon_trgping).

_testPing24H: long run test, [see here](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaTRIGGER-info#tuyadaemon_testping24h).


### Customization
To use a different hardware:
 - see: https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaTRIGGER/README.md
 - see wiki : https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaTRIGGER-info
 - see node: 'triggerMAP (readme)' details.

label: core_MQTT
info:
# tuyaDAEMON.core.MQTT #
This flow extends tuyaDEAMON.core with an MQTT broker.

### Advantages
 *   Use of standard MQTT client as UI interface to tuyaDAEMON. I chose [MQTTExplorer](http://mqtt-explorer.com) because it is easy to use, complete, portable.
 
 *   Use of standard MQTT clients applications in smartphones, (my favorite for Android is [IOT MQTT Panel](www.snrlab.in/category/iot) to build specialized interfaces to some tasks (e.g. watering)
 
 *   Interface for the exchange of data and commands with more application and automation systems that use this protocol. Using TRIGGER, we can remotely control tuyaDAEMON and the connected systems. 
 
### Installation
 
  note: **tuyadaemon.core.MQTT** can be installed (and tested) even without any Tuya device.
  
 - Download last version and import it in node-red tuyaDAEMON, using a new flow.
 - Or enable the flow, if it is present.

### Configuration

  See the node: `'global MQTT config'`: follow the node documentation.

label: mirror_devices
info:
TRIIGER use examples

To be customized by the user.

name: REFRESH
info:
Use this subflow to drive devices with `REFRESH` capability. It acts like a filter on device msg, intercepts and implements two pseudo-DP to handle the REFRESH: - SET `_refreshCycle` ` off | time [s]` : off/on polling - GET `_refreshCycle` : back last value - SET `_refresh` `dummy` : immediate REFRESH - GET `_refresh` ignored ### Parameters
deviceId string (credential)
The ID of the wired Tuya device (same as in `core.global.alldevices`).
Max_time number|string|@string
Timeout [s] for `_refreshCycle`, without `stop` message. - Use '0' for forever (requires 'stop'). - Default: `global.MAXREFRESH`, a common value for all devices. - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - **early binding**: a number, e.g. `60` - **late binding**: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.MAXREFRESH` - **evalued value**: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@global.get('MAXREFRESH')*3`
REFRESH_message JSON
Low level `Refresh message` to meet device qirk (single, repeat). One off (examples) : * BASIC: `{"operation": "REFRESH"}`; (default) * ONE: `{"operation": "REFRESH", "dps":20}`; * MANY: `{"operation": "REFRESH", "requestedDPS":[1,18,19,20]}`; * SCHEMA: = `{"operation": "REFRESH", "schema":true}`;
### Inputs All low level messages for a device. ### Outputs 1. To device: all input messages, less `_refresh` and `_refreshCycle`, plus `'REFRESH'` messages for the device. 2. To logging: some log messages. ### Details Some devices (e.g. 'AC power meter') convert and send data (PUSH) at very low frequence, and a GET returns the last PUSHed data. But sometime, e.g. when the UI is open, it is better to uptate the interface at a faster rate (smartLife app uses 5s). If the device implements the REFRESH command, the user can send two pseudoDP: 1. `_refresh`: to convert now and GET an immediate value (PUSH). 2. `_refreshCycle`: to start a automatic PUSH cycle, with an user defined rate, until a 'stop' command or until 'Max_time' has expired. note: add in `global.alldevices` the device.capability '`REFRESH`', else ERROR message. ### References see [REFRESH operation](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#refresh-operation). For the native documentation see [tuyapi](https://codetheweb.github.io/tuyapi/index.html#tuyadevicerefresh) and [node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device](https://github.com/vinodsr/node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device#input-format)

name: explode
RT/AVG filter
info:
This subflow filter for **tuyaDAEMON** allows the processing of individual messages in _real time_, or the creation of an _averaged sampling_, regardless of the device of origin. For devices in `'RT' mode`, all messages go directly to the output (no filter). For devices in `'AVG' mode`, all messages are stored. A special "trigger" message in input triggers the output for a specific device. ### Parameters
deviceIDstring (credential)
the device ID, or CID (mandatory).
decimal digitsinteger
the number of digits used in average calculations (mandatory).
dp_excludeinteger array
this excluded dPs are sent as-is, default [].
dp_roundinteger
the dPs in array are sent as integer, default [].
dp_mininteger
the dPs in array are sent as minimum, default [].
dp_MAXinteger
the dPs in array are sent as maximum, default [].
### Input device msg Any message from any device (real, virtual, custom). For details see `CORE.logging` link node. ### Input trigger msg Structure: ```` message topic = 'average' (mandatory) ```` The simplest way to generate trigger messages at fixed time intervals is to use of a standard 'input' node, setting `interval` to the required value. As example see the '433 gateway flow'. ### Details This subflow can handle messages from one device, with a user-defined strategy, and it is designed to allow for a simple upgrade for any existing **tuyaDAEMON** module or device. **Condition to enable the `AVG` mode for a device**: In the flow containg this subflow instance (usually CORE) must be defined: ```` global._AVERAGE = true|false (mandatory) ```` The simplest and user-convenient way to set this value is to add it in the `Global module config`. **Processing `dps` rules in `AVG mode`**: - This filter processes messages with one or more `dp`s, but not `dp` which produce a structure as value (see `explode` subflow): put these `dp` in the 'dp_exclude' list. - The complete `dp`s list is taken, for any device, from the `global.alldevices` object (see the `CORE.Global CORE config` node). - If a 'dp' is in the `dp_exclude` list, it is not stored, but immediately sent to the output without modifications. - Only the `dp`s with at least one value stored are present in the triggered output. - If the `dp` value '`isNaN()`' (i.e. not numeric) automatically in output is used last value. - If the `dp` value is `numeric`, in output we get the `average` of all stored input values (default). - The `average` is rounded to an integer if 'dp' is in `dp_round` list, otherwise it is with user-defined `decimal digits`. - If a 'dp' is in the `dp_MAX` or `dp_min` list, we get the `maximum` or the `minimum` value instead of the `average`. For more info [see the wiki](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/case-study:-433-MHz-weather-station#6-notes-about-rtavg-filter-subflow).

name: static retry
info:
Transform the `status` msg from a `tuya-smart-device` node into an _event_ message. Required adding a new Tuya device (alternative: `dynamic rety` subflow) ### Parameters
deviceId string (credential)
The ID of the wired Tuya device (same as in `core.global.alldevices`).
### Inputs From _tuya-smart-device_ `client satus` output. ### Outputs A new event message: ```` object { "payload":{ "deviceId": , "data": { "dps":{ "_connected": true|false }}}} ```` It can ben routed to _logging_ input node of `core` flow. ### Details Process the `status` output from a tuya-smart-device node. If the connection status changes, it creates an event for standard logging, filtering unecessary messages. Use it with Tuya devices always ON. If the device is disconnected, the reconnect interval, function(findTimeout, retryTimeout), is fixed. It is set in the _tuya-smart-device_ node (default) and modified with the pseudo-dp: - SET `_findTimeout` Integer [ms] - SET `_retryTimeout` Integer [ms] ### References For more info see [device control](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#devices-control)

name: dynamic retry
info:
Transforms the `status` msg from a _tuya-smart-device_ node into an _event_ message. Implements a dynamic retry policy. ### Parameters
deviceId string
The ID of the wired Tuya device (same as in `core.global.alldevices`).
MinTimeout number | string | @string
Low limit for fast retry [ms]. - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - **early binding**: a number | string, e.g. `1000` - **late binding**: a string starting with `global.` | `flow.` | `msg.` e.g. `global.fast-connection` - **evalued value**: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@1*1000`
MaxTimeout number | string | @string
High limit for slow retry [ms]. - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - **early binding**: a number | string, e.g. `60000` - **late binding**: a string starting with `global.` | `flow.` | `msg.` e.g. `global.fast-connection` - **evalued value**: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@1*1000`
### Inputs From _tuya-smart-device_ `client satus` output. ### Outputs 1. **event msg**: a new event message: ```` object { "payload":{ "deviceId": , "data": { "dps":{ "_connected": true|false }}}} ```` It can ben routed to `logging` input node of `core` flow. 2. a **low level SET message**: SET timeout for the device, sent directly to core `low_lev_IN` input node. ```` object { "payload":{ "toDev": idevice, "payload": { "dps": "_findTimeout", "set": }}} ```` ### Details Some devices, usully always ON, requires fast timeout to reconnect soon (see `static retry` subflow), but other devices, sometime OFF, requires a different strategy: `dynamic retry`. This subflow process the `status` output from a tuya-smart-device node. If the connection status changes, it creates an event for standard logging, filtering unecessary messages. Dynamically optimizes the timeout of Tuya device connection attempts (since `smart-tuya-device-node` 4.0.2): - When the device is _connected_, the retry timeout is fast, set to `MinTimeout`. - If the device is _disconnected_, the timeout grows randomly until a `MaxTimeout`. _Example:_ Set in `smart-tuya-device-node`: - `Interval for retry connection` = 1000 (default, 1 sec). - `Connection search interval` = 1000 With the default settings (1s, 60s), the minimum retry interval is approximately _10 seconds_ (affected by many factors). If the device is disconnected, the interval increases in random increments to approximately _sec. 60 in 9/10 minutes_ Use it with Tuya devices often OFF or not in use (e.g. mobile AC plugs). ### References For more info see [devices control](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#devices-control) For the native documentation see [node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device](https://github.com/vinodsr/node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device#input-format).

name: driver_PDMtimer001
info:
Driver for MQTT timerPDM-1 (Sonoff) This is a direct replacement for `tuya-smart-device` node. So the device `_sonoff001`, in `global.alldevices`, is among the `real` devices.
deviceId string (credential)
The user ID of the MQTT device (same as in `core.global.alldevices`).
Max_time number | string | @string
Timeout [s] for `_refreshCycle`, without `stop` message. - Use '0' for forever (requires 'stop'). - Default: `global.MAXREFRESH`, a common value for all devices. - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - **early binding**: a number | string, e.g. `60000` - **late binding**: a string starting with `global.` | `flow.` | `msg.` e.g. `global.fast-connection` - **evalued value**: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@1*1000`
### Installation I used a `dynamic rety` node, because the device is often disconnected from the mains. No configuration is required, apart from the MQTT nodes that must connect with the broker present on the switch. note: This subflow implements also `_refresh` and `_refreshCycle` pseudoDP, so the `REFRESH` node is not required.

name: do command
info:
This node creates a command for a device, i.e. the output can go to `core.std_cmds` or `core.fast_cmds` inputs nodes. General purpose, used to send tuyaDEAMON commands. ### Parameters
remote string | @string | NULL
the tuyaDEAMON instance (as in _core.global.remotemap_) or NULL. - note: NULL => delete 'remote' attribute (i.e. local) - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `foo` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.instance_name` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@Date.now()` - runtime override: from `msg.command.remote` value
device string | @string | NULL
the device user-name or `ID` or `CID` (as in 'core.global.alldevices'). - note: NULL => delete attribute 'device' (= device list) - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `core` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.instance_name` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@Date.now()` - runtime override: from `msg.command.device` value
property string | @string | NULL
the data point ID or user.name (string: "3" or "_version") - note: NULL => delete 'property' attribute (= SCHEMA) - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `_DBase` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.instance_name` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@Date.now()` - runtime override: from `msg.command.property` value
valueany | @string | NULL
the new value to SET into the device (unencoded). - note: NULL => delete 'value' attribute ( = GET) - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: boolean | number | string | JSON object, as required by DP definition in `global.alldevices` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.instance_name` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@Date.now()` - runtime override: from `msg.command.value` value
### Input Any, used only to provoke the output, but values like `msg.command.remote` can override the parameters. ### Output A standard tuyaDAEMON msg command. ### Details Standard message structure ```` object { payload :{ remote: , device: , property: , value: }} ```` rules: ```` if remote = NULL (or missed) => local instance. if device = NULL (or missed) and remote valid => GET remote device list elseif property = NULL (or missed) => GET device SCHEMA elseif value = NULL (or missed) => GET property else => SET property ```` ###References For more info see [standard tuyaDAEMON command](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-as-event-processor#standard-tuyadaemon-command)

name: do logging
info:
This subflow simulates data received from a _real tuya device_, i.e. it builds an 'event' to be sent to the `core.logging` input. General purpose, used to build events in mirror and fake devices. ### Parameters
remote string | @string | NULL
the tuyaDEAMON instance (as in _core.global.remotemap_) or NULL. - Default: NULL => delete 'remote' (i.e. local) - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `ANDROID` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.instance_name` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@global.get('instance_name')` - runtime override: from `msg.logging.remote` value
deviceID string | @string (credential)
the device user-name or `ID` or `CID` (as in _core.global.alldevices_). - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `core` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.TUYABRDG` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@"tuya"+"_bridge"` - runtime override: from `msg.logging.deviceID` value
propertyDP string | @string
the data point ID or user.name (string: "3" or "_version") - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `foo` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.COUNTDP` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@global.get()` - runtime override: from `msg.logging.propertyDP` value
valueany | @string | NULL
the new value from the device. - Default: NULL => "" - uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a string, e.g. `foo` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.instance_name` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@Date.now()` - runtime override: from `msg.logging.value` value
### Input Any, used only to provoke the output, but values like `msg.logging.remote` can override the parameters. ### Output ````` object { "payload": { "remote_from" : , // optional "deviceId": , "data": { "dps": { "" = }}} ````` ### References see [native event format](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-as-event-processor#native-event-format).

name: REDTRG
info:
Build a REDTRG SET command for the tuya_bridge device. Used in 'mirror' devices. ### Parameters
TRGnumber integer | string | @string
A count value used as trigger command. - Uses [late binding](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042) node (extended), and accepts: - early binding: a number | string, e.g. `7140` - late binding: a string starting with 'global.' | 'flow.' | 'msg.' e.g. `global.MIRRORGUARD` - evalued value: a string starting with '@', e.g. `@global.get('MIRRORGUARD') + 70 * 2` - runtime override: from `msg.TRGnumber` value
### Inputs Any, used only to provoke the output or to override the parameter (`msg.TRGnumber`). ### Outputs A **low level SET message** for the tuya_bridge device: ```` object { "payload": { "dps":, "set": }} ```` It can ben routed to `tuya_bridge_IN` input node of `core.trigger` flow. ### Details - _convention_: REDTRIG nodes and related Tuya-cloud automation are named _REDTRGnnnnn_, where nnnnn is `TRGnumber`. - _hardware dependency_: the `dp` used is defined by `core.global.COUNTDP`. ### References The TRGnumber values are user defined. For the rules and the trigger values ranges, see _triggerMAP_ in `core_trigger` flow.
See also [trigger-info](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaTRIGGER-info)

name: logging
info:
Main entry point for tuyaDEAMON events/responses.

General format (from tuya-smart-device node, modified):
````
msg.payload:{     
        "remote_from": undefined|remoteName,      // only from remote instance, see global.remotemap
        "deviceId":    gatewayID|deviceid,          // from virtual devices => "deviceId": gatewayId
        "deviceName":  name,                     // from tuya-smart-device node, optional - not used
        "data": {
            "t": Math.floor( Date.now() / 1000 );       // timestamp (sec), from tuya node, optional 
            "cid": deviceid;                                 // only from virtual devices, mandatory
            "dps":{
                "[dp]": value                               // encoded, more than one dp in some cases
                ....
            }}}}
````
warning: from virtual devices, the `msg.payload.deviceId`is the `gatewayID`, in this case tuyaDAEMON uses the `cid` as `deviceId```. To access `alldevices` use always the method `context.global.alldevices.getODev(msg.payload.deviceId)`;

Since 2.2.2: New format (see [ISSUE#4](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/issues/4)): [event:data]: `{"online":["a4c138******","a4c1383********","a4c138f******","804b50*******"],"offline":[]}`

Fake/custom devices uses a reduced structure:
````
msg.payload:{     
        "remote_from": undefined|SVxx             // only from remote instance, see global.remotemap
        "deviceId":    dev-name|deviceid,        
        "data": {
            "dps":{
                "[dp-name|dp]": value                   // one or many dp, native value can be encoded 
                ....
            }}}}
````

CORE processing:
 - fires related 'share' if defined in core.global.alldevices
 - fires actions if user defined in 'mirror' flows.

CORE logging:
 - updates the|many `global.tuyastatus[dev-name][dp-name] = value-decoded`
 - trace on node-red debug.pad
 - send one|many MQTT messages to broker
 - add one|many records to DB
 - send back a HTTP response if started by a REST command.

note
 - if 't' value is missed, it is addeded by CORE.
 - "deviceName" is the `tuya-smart-device` node name, used only locally in the flow, not used by tuyaDAEMON.

see 'std_cmds' node.

name: std_cmds
info:
Main entry point for tuyaDEAMON commands:

For a great incapsulation, external application can use only `usr-device-name`, `usr-property-name` and `usr-decoded-data`, as defined by [global.alldevices.](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices) 

- user-name can change in any moment, so TuyaDAEMON, extensions, fake devices must use the deviceID, dp, and encoded data.

- see also [commands](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-as-event-processor#commands).

`msg.payload` for **SET** command (to set a device status or to trigger an action, in this case value MUST exist but it is discarted)
````
{  "remote"  : undefined|`SVRxxx`,        //  remote tuyaDEAMON ID, optional: see global.remotemap. 
   "device"  : `dev-usr`|`cid`|`id`,      //  device-name.
   "property": `dp-usr`|`pseudoDP`|`dp`,  //  propery-name 
   "value"   : `any`|`accepted_value` }   //  uncoded value (see alldevice: 'type' and 'typefiel')
````

`msg.payload` for **GET** command (to get a value asking the device or using last from **global.tuyastatus** ):
````
{  "remote"  : undefined|`SVRxxx`,        //  remote tuyaDEAMON ID, optional: see global.remotemap. 
   "device"  : `dev-usr`|`cid`|`id`,      //  device-name.
   "property": `dp-usr`|`pseudoDP`|`dp`}  //  propery-name 
````

`msg.payload` for **GET schema** command (send to device or get value from **global.tuyastatus** ):
````
{  "remote"  : undefined|`SVRxxx`,    //  remote tuyaDEAMON ID, optional: see global.remotemap. 
   "device"  : `dev-usr`|`cid`|`id` } //  device-name.
````

`msg.payload` for **device LIST** from a remote tuyaDAEMON instance:
````
{  "remote"  : `SVRxxx`,              //  remote tuyaDEAMON ID: see global.remotemap. 
````

`msg.payload` for **SET multiple** command (_deprecated because uses dps index and coded data_):
````
{  "remote"  : undefined|`SVRxxx`,       //  remote tuyaDEAMON ID, optional: see global.remotemap. 
   "device"  : `dev-usr`|`cid`|`id`,     //  device-name.
   "property": `MULTIPLE`,               //  pseudoOP
   "value"   : {dp1:val1, dp2:val2...}}  //  coded values 
````


**Commands handling**
Others CORE INPUT nodes: 
   -  'fast_cmds'    (no logTX, std msg), 
   -  'fake_cmds_IN' (no logTX, normalized msg),
   -  'low_level_in' (no logTX, native device msg + pseudoDP), 
   -  'share_in'     (no logTX, share msg).

name: OUT msg process
info:
_tuyaDAEMON process chain for messages coming from all device._

Input: msg from any `smart-tuya-device` node or from 'fake' devices or internally generated.

Ouput: 
  - the global.tuyastatus object is updated.
  - a log of every command and received data is stored in the 'messages' DB table.
  - info, trace and warning messages are output on the debug pad.
  
The user can control the info and trace messages and select the stored records.

_See also_: `'to logging'` input link node for the OUT msg structure.

OUT msg structures:

example: msg (real)
 ````
        {
        _msgid: "12342f3fd.8697fc"
        _event: "node:12343963.a7d846"
        payload: object
           deviceId: "123455aa196ae5975cy6ii"
           deviceName: "*tuya_bridge" 
           data: object
              t: 1609234903  // timestamp, in seconds.
              dps: object
                 102: 1020   // array of dp:value
        }
```` 

example msg: (virtual)
````
        {
        _msgid: "12346a44.e81238"

           deviceId: "123473b1b789b4994cro7p"
           deviceName: "Zigbee Gateway"
           data: object
              cid: "12348d00856a1c15"
              t: 1609235292
              dps: object
                 102: 1020   // array of dp:value
        }             
````

name: fast_cmds
info:
Fast INPUT (internal use)

Differences from standard INPUT commands:
 
1.  No command echo on debug pad, no log on DB (like hide="CT")

2.  No test of the device capabilities in `alldevices`: all commands are processed. i.e. _use `fast_cmds` with care, only with tested commands._
3.  Only the following capabilities of a DP, defined in `alldevices`, are processed:
 - "SKIP" : the command is not sent to device.
 - "WW" or "GW" : any GET is replaced by SET(null).
 
4.  _We can set `device.capabilities='NONE'` to block all commands from user, but still executing commands from 'fast_cmds'._
 
4.  _We can set `dp.capability='TRG'` to block all commands from user, but still executing commands from 'fast_cmds'._
 
5.  Internal use: share, custom devices, extensions.

6.  For tuyaDEAMON user commands see 'std_cmds' node.

name: share IN
info:
## ENTRY point to execute a 'share'

Usually 'share' are defined in `global.alldevices`, so an Event can trigger one of more Commands.

But a 'share' can live also alone, and the user as an alternative way to fire commands in tuyaDEAMON,
sending here a 'share', or using the SYSTEM property 'doSHARE'.
````
share object Format:
     "info": {                     // auto from trigger event or user (optional)
                                 // uses: info.device, info.property, info.value
                  ""                // used as default 'IN parameters' in action
             }
     "share": [{
        "test": [                                      // optional: default true
           `condition-string-1`        // eval(condition-string-1) => true|false          
            ... more test strings (AND) ... ],
        "action": [{                                  // standard command fields
            "remote"  : "NAMEXX",                                    // optional
            "device"  : @expession | string | null | undefined,
            "property": @expession | string | null | undefined,    
            "value"   : @expession | string | object | null | undefined
             } ... more actions (sequence)...]
         } ... more {(test[],) action[]} (selection) ...
      ]
````
Special rules of evaluation for action.device (and action.property, action.value) to build the actual cammand:

    share.action.device = @expession       => command.payload.device = eval(expession)
    share.action.device = string | object  => command.payload.device = string | object
    share.action.device = null             => command.payload.device = undefined
    share.action.device = undefined|missed => command.payload.device = info.device || undefined.
    
- see [share definition](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#share-actions)
- see also [share use](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-as-event-processor#tuyadeamon-chains-and-custom-devices)

examples: see in `global.alldevices` the implementation of these properties, all implemented using 'share':
      - core._heartbeat: a 'cron' implementation
      - system._beep_loop: a new 'method' 
      - system.doBenchmark: a new 'method' 
      - tuya_bridge._tstPing24H: a new 'method'

name: CUSTOMIZE tuya devices (readme)
info:
## INSTALLATION NOTE CORE devices (disabled) are present in ver. 2.2.2 distributed only as examples of using some special subflows, to [fine-tune device](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#subflow-implementation) behavior: the user must replace them with their own devices. One of (required): - `Static retry`: the delay between connection attempts is fixed once in 'tuya_smart_device' or in the driver node. Use this as default. - `Dynamic retry`: the delay between connection attempts is between a minimum and a maximum. Extra (optional): - `RT/AVG`: for devices that push lots of data - `explode`: to expand data structures - `REFRESH`: for (rare) devices that handle the 'REFRESH' command (and you have to use it). Before inserting your devices: - _Delete all example devices, relate nodes, clean also the `device selector` node_ (output 1 is reserved to `tuya_bridge`, don't delete it). ------------------------- ## How to add a new [device](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#tuyadaemon-devices) Add to CORE flow the `'real' tuya-devices` i.e. the devices handled by `smart-tuya-device` nodes, or equivalent implementations. For more detail, see `core.devices selector` node informations. Then update the `global.alldevices.real`, and finally the `*catch device and LAN errors` node. For the the `'virtual' tuya-devices` i.e. the subdevices handled by a gateway: - add the "real" gateway to CORE flow (if not present). - update `global.alldevices.real` for the gateway (if not present), - update `global.alldevices.virtual` for the device. For the `'fake' device`, use a custom flow for any device. Add them to `global.alldevices.fake`
For the `'mirror' devices` you MUST use the [**core_TRIGGER**](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaTRIGGER) flow. ------------------------- ## ADDING DEVICES details To add `standard 'real' Tuya` devices: - see WIKY/["Howto: add a new device to tuyaDAEMON"](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/Howto:-add-a-new-device-to-tuyaDAEMON) for step-by-step process. - see [devices definition: JSON 'global.alldevices'](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#devices-definition-json-globalalldevices) for format details. - see [Devices availables](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/devices#devices-availables) a collection of data about some known Tuya devices. - see [TuyaDAEMON-toolkit](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-toolkit) helper application for new device. To add `standard 'virtual' Tuya` devices, that uses a gateway: - add to CORE the the gateway, as standard 'real' device, if not already present, and update `global.alldevices.real`. - any 'virtual' device requires only an entry in `global.alldevices.virtual`, using also `cid` and `gateway` (see [model](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#devices-definition-json-globalalldevices)) in the 'virtual' branch of alldevices. _The ['fake'](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#tuyadaemon-devices) devices are not handled by tuyAPI: "mirror", "derived", "custom", and "SW only" devices._ To add `'mirror' Tuya` devices, you must use [core_TRIGGER](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaTRIGGER) module: - see WIKI/["tuyaTRIGGER info"](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaTRIGGER-info) - see WIKY example/["mirror device 'Smoke_Detector': case study"](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/mirror-device-'Smoke_Detector':-case-study) To define `'derived' devices`, which are composed of multiple devices (Object Oriented style) : - see [details](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones) - see WIKY example/["derived device 'watering_sys': case study"](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/derived-device-'watering_sys':-case-study) To add `custom devices` (not Tuya) you always need to develop a node-red flow as an interface. Some examples serve as a guide: - USB/COM devices: WIKY example/[PM_detector](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-'PM-detector':-case-study) - MQTT devices: WIKY example/[Sonoff PDMtimer](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device--MQTT-'Ozone_PDMtimer'-) - 433MHz device: WIKY example/[weather station](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/case-study:-433-MHz-weather-station) `Software only` devices, like libraries that add functionality of specific interest to tuyaDAEMON, external API stubs, etc.: - WIKY example/[_system](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system)

name: pseudo DPs
info: Filter and processes all pseudoDP (see [here](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#pseudodp))

name: fake_cmds_IN
info:
INPUT for direct commands to _local fake devices_.

Command format for all local 'fake' and custom devices:
   the Message is in rich `normalizated` format to speedup next elaborations:

used to update `global.tuyastatus` (are standard items but redefined)
-   `msg.payload.device   = usr-dev-name|msg.to`
-   `msg.payload.property = undef|usr-dp-name|msg.infodp`
-   `msg.payload.value    = undef|any`  

used as keys:
-   `msg.to     = cid|deviceId`       (mandatory)
-   `msg.infodp = dp|pseudoDP`        (mandatory)
-   `msg.hide   = undef|""|"KCERT"`   ([visibility](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#output-control), since 2.2.0)

rules:
- Only for local devices, not handled by the 'tuya-smart-device' nodes.
- pseudoDPs are defined in `context.global.PSEUDODP` object.
     [see wiki](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#pseudodp)
- The device|dp `capabilities` are not checked in global.alldevices.
- The device _connection status is not checked.
- SCHEMA: `infodp` = 'schema', `property`= undefined, `value`= undefined
- GET: `value` = undefined
- SET: `value` = defined, any value, also object.

unused in _fake devices_:
-  `msg.toDev  = gatewayId|deviceId` (real devices selector)
-  MULTIPLE: `infodp` = 'multiple', `property` = 'multiple', `value` = coded, sent 'as is' to device.

- see also [normalized command](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-as-event-processor#normalized-command)

name: sql_BD
info:
##  Entry point for DB (sql)

Format to execute user sql (routed to DBlocal, DBremote..., with log)

       {
        to:     "_dBase",                             // extra-device, DB subsystem
        infodp: "_sqlDBlocal"|"_sqlDBremote"|...,     // default two dp (2 DB)
        hide: "",
        topic:  `sql-string`
       } 

For more than 2 DB: see `CUSTOMIZE: DBase servers (readme)` node.        

Reference: Format for tuyaDAEMON DB Logging purpose (routed to DBlocal, no log):

       {
        to|from: `deviceId`|`cid`,  // mandatory
        infodp:  `property`,
        hide: "",
        topic:   "INSERT ..."     // sql
       }

name: CUSTOMIZE: DBase servers (readme)
info:
_This implementeation can use 0, 1, or 2 Dbases_ :
  
The two databases are called: `DBlocal` and `DBremote`.
- disable all DBlocal/DBremote nodes if not used (default).

To store the log on DB:

**Preconditions** (see [here](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/blob/main/tuyaDAEMON/README.md#installation))

- TuyaDAEMON CORE installed, SYSTEM optional.
- Verify DB accessibility and credentials using _MyPhpAdmin_.
- the `tuyathome.messages` table must exist with required fields: import `DB_CORE.2.2.2.sql` using _MyPhpAdmin_)

**CORE config**
- setup `store on DB local` and `execute on DB local` nodes and related `local` MySQLdatabase configuration node.
- setup `execute on DB remote` node and related `remote` MySQLdatabase configuration node (optional, requires SYSTEM).
- on `DBlocal` (but it can be really a remote DB, changing the configuration)  **CORE** stores the log of all commands (`TX`) and events (`RX`) processed.
- CORE uses only the `tuyathome.messages` table to store log messages (see `core.BD command filter` node)
- With `SYSTEM` the user can send custom SQL commands to both DBs ([see wiki](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#db-functions), using two ad hoc properties: `_sqlDBlocal` and `_sqlDBremote`.

**data logging fine-tuning**

 - The user can fine-tune the log to see only interesting data, on a device/property basis, in the global.alldevices structure: [see the wiki](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#output-control).


## Extensions
USE CASE: Maybe you like to do something like this:
- to store only some devices/properties in an open `wehater` DB,
- to store other devices/properties in a `security` DB installed in a protected server running 24/7
- and the others in the `debug` DB on the development PC (only for debug, usually disabled).

You can: if you need to use more than two DBs with the same tuyaDAEMON instance, it is easy to duplicate the  DBremote node structure and configuration as required.
   
1. In `CORE` flow you must do:
     - Add the required nodes.
     - edit `DB command filter` node adding more outputs 
     - edit `DB log event filter` to routing messages.
     - edit `All DB status` node to check the new DB nodes
     
2. In `SYSTEM` flow you must add new commands (new DPs: e.g. `sqlDBweater`) to send SQLs to new DBs. You must modify:
     -  `_system custom selector (3)`  node to implement SET and GET.

3. finally update
     -  `global.alldevices.fake._system`: add to _system the new commands (DPs).

name: CORE startup process (readme)
info:
Message from CORE (alone) on startup (only if DB nodes are enabled):

    ["RX: 'HAL@home'/'_DBase' ",true]  

or, in case of DB problems (check configuration nodes):  

    msg : error
    "Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 192.168.1.19:3306" (can change)

    ["RX: 'HAL@home'/'_DBase' ", false ] 

--------------------------------------------------

Tipical startup sequence (core+system+trigger+MQTT) after a 'Restart Flows':

           [ "RX: core/_DBase", true ]                       // DB very fast

           [ "RX: tuya_bridge/_connected", false ]           // initial value
           [ "RX: HAL@home/_WiFinet", false ]
           [ "RX: HAL@home/_WiFiunconnected", array[1] ]

           [ "RX: tuya_bridge/_connected", true ]            // successful attempt 
           [ "RX: HAL@home/_LANnet", true ]
           [ "RX: HAL@home/_WiFinet", true ]
           [ "RX: HAL@home/_WiFiunconnected", array[0] ]

           [ "RX: core/_heartbeat", "16:46:44" ]             // 5s from start
                                                             // then every 30s
           
           ["RX: HAL@home/_laststart","2022-04-08 16:46:49"] // 10 s from start


**heartbeat**

    ["DEVPC: RX: 'core'/'heartbeat' ","20:57:56"]
    
This is a PUSH event from core, default is every 30s after 5s.

 note:  You can:
 - change the period (editing the 'heartbeat' input node) 
 - control the logging rules ('hide' in global.alldevices, default: "R" = do not store in DBase) 
 - eliminate it (disabling the node).
  
  
**version**
  See the test node "GET version" readme.

name: heartbeat
info:
heartbeat event creation.

PUSH event usend in tests, as watchog, etc.

The payload is from "core.heartbeat" node, fired every 30s (default, defined in the 'heartbeat' node).

To reduce the heartbeat visibility update the 'hide' in 'global.alldevices.fake.core.dps._heartbeat' (general rule): 

  - Set 'hide' to "" | "K" | "E" | "R" to log: 'all' | 'nothing' | 'only DB' | 'only debugpad + MQTT' 
     (it is an event, so do not use "C" and "T").

name: SET info
info:
Test the SET '_info' property of core, using the msg:

         payload: {
            device: "_core",
            property: "_info",
            value: "any"
            }
- action: this SET acts as a trigger ( 'value' is requited, but not used)
 Core updates the list of modules and devices.

- Return: the list of modules in use and the list of actually connected devices, gouped as real, virtual and fake devices.

IN _global.alldevices_ the default definition is:

                {
                    "dp": "_info",
                    "name": "version",
                    "capability": "RW"
                }
note:  RW = SET and GET

---------------------------
Expected result

    TX: GET fake core/version
    
then: 

    ["RX: core/version object] 
  
Openninig the answer object we get (configuration dependent):

 - minimal (only core)

````
    array[2]
      0: "RX: core/version "
      1: object
                      // here list of 'connected' devices
         devices: object
           real: array[0]
           virtual: array[0]
           fake: array[1]
              0: "core"
                      // here list of 'enabled' flows
         core: "2.2.2"
````

- rich (core+trigger+mqtt+system):
````
    array[2]
      0: "RX: core/version "
      1: object
         devices: object
           real: array[1]
             0: "tuya_bridge"
          virtual: array[0]
          fake: array[2]
             0: "core"
             1: "HAL@home"
      core_system: "2.2.0"
      core_trigger: "2.2.0"
      core_mqtt: "2.2.0"
      core: "2.2.2"
````  

_General rule: if you set a user friendly 'name' for a device and/or a property (in core.global.alldevices) all output messages and the global.tuyastatus will use this name_ (e.g. 'version' vs. _info).

- _In the input messages you can use both, the name or the ID:_
````
    payload.property = "version"
or    
    payload.property = "_info"      

````
 - Never change strings starting with '_': they are  code defined IDs and cannot be changed.

To have a more rich test experince, this subflow implementation follows the rules:

1) if you set as value any string that starts with:
    -  global.
    -  flow.
    -  msg.

the value is keep from the object you entered.
[See](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/subflows-and-configuration-late-and-runtime-parameters-binding/60042)

example:

   `global.tuyastatus.core._heartbeat` 

sets the parameter to last heartbeat time like `"19:06:44"`


2) The special value `"NULL"` deletes the propery.

Exanple:

   `remote = SOME`
   
output msg:  
````
   msg.payload: {
              "remote_from" : "SOME",   
              "deviceId" : <deviceID>
              ..... more
````   
but:
   `remote = NULL`
   
output msg:  
````
   msg.payload: {
               "deviceId" : <deviceID>
              ..... more
````

name: TESTING CORE Command process (readme)
info:
Testig command (standard/fast) core function.

This examples build a cammand message.

**tuyaDAEMON commands**
````
        "payload": {
              "remote"  : NULL | <remote>,      
              "device"  : NULL | <usr-devname>|<deviceID>
              "property": NULL | <usr-propname>|<propertyDP>
              "value"   : NULL | <as-required (decoded)>
        }}}}

rules:
if remote =    NULL => local instance (remote requires SYSTEM module)
if device =    NULL (remote MUST exist) => get the list of remote devices 
                 else it MUST exist in global.alldevices else ERROR
if property =  NULL (device MUST exist) => SCHEMA (test: allowed by device?)
                 else (device MUST exist and) it MUST exist in global.alldevices else ERROR
if value =     NULL (property MUST exist)  =>   GET (test: allowed by dp?)
                 else  (property MUST exist ) =>   SET (test: allowed by dp?) and type checked against global.alldevices or by an optional encode function: else ERROR
````

Differences  `fast_cmds` vs. `std_cmds`:
- fast_cmds: device capabilities are not checked.
- fast_cmds: only "SKIP", "WW", "GW" DP capabilities (in global.alldevices) are tested to process commands.
- fast_cmds: no command log (as hide="CT")


**case ok:**
 - remote:  NULL (to use this test: chhose NULL = undefined / delete)
 - deviceID: e.g. core
 - propertyPD: must exist in global.alldevices | NULL (SCHEMA)
         e.g. NULL |  _info
 - value: NULL (GET) | as required by propertyPD (SET)

Expected result (local.code._info GET) like:
     
      TX: GET fake core/version                         // not in case of 'fast_cmds'

then:     
 
      ["RX: core/version","2.2.2"]    // after startup, before any core._info.SET(any)

or:      
      ["RX: core/version", object]                     // after a core._info.SET(any)


**Error messages:**
 bad remote (both Std/Fast):
      ASSERT fail: 'remote' requires the '_system' module installed.       

 bad deviceID (both Std/Fast):
      ERROR [normalize]: not found the device 'fake' in global.alldevices.

 bad propertyDP (both Std/Fast):
 
      WARNING [normalize]: In alldevices missed the 'core':dps[fake] definition."     
 
    then (Std Cmds):
      ERROR: The _core device does not implement the 'fake' property
 
  or (Fast Cmds): 
      TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'capability')

note: this test is useful also to test new devices.

xamples

1. GET core.version local:

> remote:   NULL
> device:   core
> property: version
> value:    NULL

Expected result (configuration dependent)

     ["RX: 'core/version' object] 

2. GET locale device list

 > remote:   global.instance_name   
 > device:   NULL
 > property: NULL
 > value:    NULL

Expected result (requires system, configuration dependent)

      [ "DEVPC: RX: HAL@home/list", array[3] ]
          (DEVPC = actual local instance name)

expanded:

    array[2]
        0: "DEVPC: RX: HAL@home/list"
        1: array[3]
            0: "HAL@home"
            1: "core"
            2: "tuya_bridge"

core properties

// for _heartbeat,  inizialize local with a valid timestamp
flow.set("lastts", Date.now());
info:
Catch all 'core' SET / GET commands and implements it. The others messages goes to output. ## General rules about the custom devices implementation > 1) SET changes a value (or _Data Point_). > Returns this value (or the value actually set, if different: e.g. rounded)
> > 1) or SET is used as a _trigger_ to activate some internal device operations. > In this use, the 'value' (which MUST exist because it is a SET) can be discarded ('any'). > SET returns the result value (or 'done', 'error',...). > > 2) GET returns the actual value, also from `global.tuyastatus` for simplicity. > Repeatable, without side effects. > > 4) REFRESH, if implemented, MUST produce the (eventual) update of some internal Data Points and return only the modified DPs. > > 3) SCHEMA, if implemented, MUST return the actual value for _all GETtable DPs_ of the device. > The data can be a struct of `{dp: value}` in a single message (tuyaDEAMON records this as separate msg) ```` "data": { "dps":{ "dp": value "dp": value .... }} ```` >      or the device can return a message for each DP. >

info:
OUTPUT for commands to fake devices, unprocessed by tuyaDAEMON CORE.

Flows implementing "fake" devices receive their inputs from this node.

- Same message format as 'fake_cmds_IN' INPUT (see).
- see also [normalized command](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-as-event-processor#normalized-command)

name: GET _DBase
info:
Test a GET _DBase property of core.
  
      payload: {
           device: "_core",
           property: "_DBase"
           }   
         
- Returns the last '_DBase' status

IN global.alldevices the default definition is:

               {
                  dp: "_DBase"
                  capability: "RO"   
                  type: "boolean"
               },
               
This property 'PUSH's any variation. The user can only GET 
last PUSHed value (in globel.alldevices capability: "RO", i.e. 'read only')
----------------------
Expected result

    TX: GET fake core/_DBase
    
then: 

    ["RX: core/_DBase none]    // all DB disabled
    ["RX: core/_DBase false]   // error in one (or more) DB
    ["RX: core/_DBase true]    // all DBs connected.

name: GET version
info:
Test the GET '_info' property of core, using the msg:

         payload: {
            device: "_core",
            property: "version",
            }

 Returns last list of modules and devices in use or 'none'
----------------------
Expected result

     TX: GET fake core/version
    
then: 

Before you use an _info(SET) command you get a string, the CORE version.

     ["RX: core/version","2.2.2"]

After any _info(SET) command you get an object, the last data
i.e. same response as last SET (see 'SET info' test).

name: GET _heartbeat
info:
Test a GET _heartbeat property of core.
  
      payload: {
           device: "_core",
           property: "_heartbeat"
           }   
         
- Returns the last '_heartbeat' time.

IN global.alldevices the default definition is:

               {
                    "dp": "_heartbeat",
                    "hide": "R",
                    "capability": "RO",
                    "typefield": "TSTAMP2TIME"
                }
               
This property 'PUSH's at regular frequence (see 'heartbeat' node). The used can only GET last PUSHed value (in global.alldevices capability: "RO", i.e. 'read only') .

note:
 - "typefield": "TSTAMP2TIME" defines the decoding data function.
 - "hide": "R" to not save in DB _heartbeat records.
 
----------------------
Expected result

     "TX: GET fake core/_heartbeat"
then
     [ "RX: core/_heartbeat", "09:27:31" ]

name: TESTING CORE SHARE commands (readme)
info:
Testig SHARE command (share IN) core function.


**tuyaDEAMON user share**
    
```
     "info": {                     
                  ""        // any, used as 'IN parameters' into the expressions
             }
     "share": [{
        "test": [                                      // optional: default true
           `condition-string-1`        // eval(condition-string-1) => true|false          
            ... more test strings (AND) ... ],
        "action": [{                                  // standard command fields
            "remote"  : "NAMEXX" | null,                                    // optional
            "device"  : @expession | string | null | undefined,
            "property": @expession | string | null | undefined,    
            "value"   : @expession | boolean | int | string | object | null | undefined
             } ... more actions (sequence)...]
         } ... more {(test[],) action[]} (selection) ...
      ]
    
```
Special rules of evaluation for action.device (and property, value) to build the actual cammand:
    
```
    share.action.device = @expession       => command.payload.device = eval(expession)
    share.action.device = string (object)  => command.payload.device = share.action.device
    share.action.device = null             => command.payload.device = undefined
    share.action.device = undefined|missed => command.payload.device = info.device || undefined.
````
- [see definition](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#share-actions)
- [see use](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-as-event-processor#share-and-command-chains)

This example build an user 'share' message: see node description.

name: user share
info:
Sample 'share'

Using a 'share' to build a conditional command.

rule: 

     if (actual-time > info.start (e.g. "11:00:00")) do:
            GET   core._info()
     else do:
            GET   core._DBase()

note: this implementation requires _heartbeat running:

     "test": ["tuyastatus.core._heartbeat > msg.info.start"],


To use a time test unrelated to _heartbeat, replace with:

     "test": ["var xnow = new Date();
               (xnow.toLocaleTimeString() > msg.info.start)"],

name: *ENCODE/DECODE user library
info:
CUSTOMIZATION

This node builds 2 singleton objects (function arrays):
- `context.global.dataencode`
- `context.global.datadecode`

A new device can require two functions for some `dP`s: 
 - `decode` (to GET data FROM device): `user = decode(value)`
 - `encode` (to SET user data TO device): `value = encode(user)`.

Goals:
 - to change value units (TuyaDAEMON uses SI units)
 - to use code64 structures and arrays
 - to change enum to user-friendy values
 - etc...

This is under user control 
- By default you find a collection of useful functions for [known devices](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/devices), which you can use as template.
- Edit this node code to add a new custom decode/encode functions:
````
context.global.datadecode.CODENAME = function (value) {
    .....
     return(uservalue);
    }:

context.global.dataencode.CODENAME = function (uservalue) {
    .....
     return(value);
    }:
````
- Use same name for both functions (e.g. CODENAME).

note: in case of bad input data, this functions can throw an error:
````
  if (....) {
        throw "'value' is not valid hex|rgb object!";
        }
````
then: 
- add the new CODENAME in `tuyahome.lookupdecode` DB table (if you use tuyadaemon-toolkit)
- now you can use CODENAME in global.alldevices, in the 'dp.typefield'

name: TESTING CORE Logging process (readme)
info:
Testig event core function.

This example allow the user to build any event message.

**tuyaDAEMON events** (basic, see `core.logging` node)
````
msg.payload:{     
        "remote_from": undefined|rem-name                  // only if from remote
        "deviceId": deviceID|dev-name       
        "data": {
            "dps":{
                [dp|dp-name]: value                        // encoded if required
                ....                                           // one or more DPs
            }}}}

rules:
remote_from =  undefined => local instance (remote requires SYSTEM module)  
                  else (test: in `global.remotemap`?) 'rem-name' else 'UNKNOWN'.
deviceId  :  MUST exist in `global.alldevices` else ERROR
dp|dp-name  :  MUST exist in `global.alldevices` else WARNING
value     :  if `DP.typefield` exists the value is checked by the decode() function, else any.
````

**case ok:**
 - remote:  NULL (in node `do logging` process: NULL => undefined) or rem-name (from `global.remotemap`)
 - deviceID:    e.g. 'core' or '_core'.
 - propertyPD:  e.g.   `_DBase`, `_heartbeat`...
 - value: Examples
       ` _DBase`: "type": "boolean". Accepted: any.
        `_heartbeat`: "typefield": "TSTAMP2TIME". Accepted timestamp, i.e. any number > 0 (see core.*ENCODE/DECODE user library node).
------------------

Expected result (local.code._heartbeat("123456789")) :
 
      [ "RX: core/_heartbeat", "11:17:36" ]    

Expected result (ANDROID.code._DBase("maybe")) :
    
      ["ANDROID: RX: core/_DBase","maybe"]
 
 
**Error messages:**

 bad remote:

      ASSERT fail: 'remote' requires the '_system' module installed.   
  or:      
      ["UNKNOWN: RX: core/_heartbeat","11:17:36"]

 bad deviceID:
 
      "ERROR [OUT data]: ADD to alldevices the real/fake deviceId: corex (undefined)"
      
 bad propertyDP:
 
      ["WARNING [OUT data]: In alldevices missed the 'core':dps[fake] definition."]

    then (the unknown DPs are always processed to capture rare events from devices):

      ["ANDROID: RX: core/fake","maybe"]
 
 bad value (variable: from decode() function):
    
     ["ANDROID: RX: core/_heartbeat", "Invalid Date"]

xamples

1. GET core.version local:

> remote:   NULL
> device:   core
> property: version
> value:    NULL

Expected result (configuration dependent)

    TX: GET fake 'core'/'version'
    
then: 

    ["RX: 'core/version' object] 

2. GET locale device list

 > remote:   global.instance_name
 > device:   NULL
 > property: NULL
 > value:    NULL

Expected result (requires system, configuration dependent)

      DEVPC: TX: GET device LIST
       (DEVPC = actual local instance name)
      
      [ "TX: SET fake HAL@home/_proxy", object ]
then:

      [ "DEVPC: RX: HAL@home/list", array[3] ]

expanded:

    array[2]
        0: "DEVPC: RX: HAL@home/list"
        1: array[3]
            0: "HAL@home"
            1: "core"
            2: "tuya_bridge"

info:
## CORE Configuration User defined: _global.alldevices_
To add a _new device_, or for fine tune an existing one, or to add `share` actions. Same in all instances. - see [global.alldevices](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices) - see also [tuyaDEAMON-toolkit](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-toolkit). _global.remotemap_
Mandatory for every tuyaDAEMON instance. Two URLs for every instance in LAN. Same in all instances. - see [NET extensions](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#net-extensions) _global.instance_name_
The name of this instance. note: same as in remotemap. _flow.alldevice_file_path_
The dir to save a copy of alldevices (node 'EXPORT alldevices') - See also the [tuyaDEAMON-toolkit](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMON-toolkit) and `tuyadaemon-things` (under construction) applications, for the management of alldevices. - If `'tuyadaemontoolkit'` is installed, use: `...tuyadeamontoolkit\devicedata` ### Device control _global.MAXREFRESH_
Default (60s) 'max_time' for all REFRESH device action (see [REFRESH subflow](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#refresh-operation)). Used in case of fast REFRESH for UI. Can be overwrited on device basis. _global.<device_id>_AVERAGE
Switch (true|false) to enable data average for devices that uses ["RT/AVG filter"](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/case-study:-433-MHz-weather-station#8-notes-about-rtavg-filter-subflow) subflow (see) ------------------------------- ### DataBase SETUP click the `'CUSTOMIZE: DBase servers'` node for info. ### new DEVICES SETUP: click the `CUSTOMIZE tuya devices (readme)` node for info. - To add/modify `encode/decode functions` to handle new formats of device data, see the node: `*ENCODE/DECODE user library`. ### Adding new Tuya devices see the wiki: https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/Howto:-add-a-new-device-to-tuyaDAEMON ### Updating devices from a precedent version. Open tuyaDAEMON new and the old one as well (using a lan or [different ports](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#multiple-instances-of-tuyadaemon-in-the-same-server)). In the old: select the nodes (device selector, refresh, tuya_smart, retry) and EXPORT to clipboard the 'selected nodes'. In the new: open the 'core' flow and IMPORT from Clipboard (do not import subflows): - Restore connections. - update '*catch device and LAN errors' node - Update the global.alldevice from old using 'cut+paste' or the tools: tuyadaemonthings and tuyadamontool. ------------------------------ ### Programmer's notes: **Checklist:** - in _Global CORE config_ node set the `instance_name` - in _Global CORE config_ node update the `remoteMAP` with `instance_name` - in _Global CORE config_ node set `alldevice_file_path` to a local value. - in all CORE `DB nodes` verify the correct associations with `DB configuration` nodes ### IMPORTANT: node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device updating. For better performances with tuyaDAEMON, you can replace the standard node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device with an updated version. This will produce fewer 'error messages' and faster device connections, an important factor in having many devices. - download the file `tuya-smart-device-updated.4.1.1.zip` from https://github.com/vinodsr/node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device/issues/83 - or download the file `tuya-smart-device - 501-fixed.zip` from https://github.com/vinodsr/node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device/issues/113 - make a copy of the file `[D:\nodered\flow-1984]\node_modules\node-red-contrib-tuya-smart-device\src\tuya-smart-device.js` as backup. - replace `tuya-smart-device.js` with the new file. - done: restart node-red ### details - Private IN/OUT link nodes for internal flow use: they are all without labels and with a special double arrow icon ('fa_expand' icon). - Private IN/OUT intra-flows links are without a label. - Public IN/OUT link nodes, useful for custom devices or extension flows: they are all labeled, and the accepted `'msg'` format is in the node documentation. The 'Deploy', after a module 'Import', sometimes (not clear why) does not set correctly external 'link' nodes.
**Important: After an 'Import' + 'Deploy', CHECK all links nodes**.
As a help, the name of all Links shows the origin or the destination (e.g.: `from core.'to fake devices'`, `to core.'logging'`) **Custom extensions are easy in the areas:** - new device data encoding/decoding functions, to translate device data into a human format. There are now 14 functions, but you can add more for your devices (see '*ENCODE/DECODE user library' node) - number and strategy of use of the DBs: the default value is max 2 DBs, and all the event and command logs go into a single DB. Maybe you need to change this (see 'CUSTOMIZE: DBase servers (readme)' node)

name: *device selector
info:
CUSTOMIZATION:

- For a new device
    - Add one output
    - Add a new rule on 'msg.toDev' property using the deviceID
    - Wire the new output to new 'tuya-smat-device' node.

see: [Howto: add a new device to tuyaDAEMON](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/Howto:-add-a-new-device-to-tuyaDAEMON)

note:
 -  Installing a new devices, use only the `static retry` node.
 -  When all ok you can do [fine-tuning](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#refresh-operation):
    - if the device can handle the `REFRESH` command (e.g. AC power meters) you can add the `REFRESH` subflow and add `'REFRESH'` to device capabilities in `global.alldevices`.
    - if the device can be disconnected for longtime (e.g. mobile plugs) better to replace `static retry` with `dynamic retry` subflow.
    - if the device PUSHes too many data, you can add the `RT/AVG` subflow.
    - if a device value is a data structure, you can add one `explode` subflow.

 - Use in 'device selector', 'tuya-smarty-device', 'static/dinamic retry', etc... the SAME `deviceID` as in `global.alldevices`.
 - The position 1 is reserved to `'tuya_brige'` device.

CUSTOMIZATION

- duplicate for any new device alltime connected
- set properties: deviceID.

for more info: see "*device selector" node documentation.

name: checks all fake cmds, _system cmd selector (1)
info:
Fake device rules:

GET: returns last value, in some cases from `tuyastatus.device.property`
    do not use it as TRIGGER: GET is without side effect, can be repeated.
    
SET: set a value, returns the same value setted.

SET as TRIGGER: the value CAN be discarted ('any').
   Returns always immediatly a value, data or only info like "done", "sent", "WARNING...", ...
   Can PUSH more results later.
 
SCHEMA: returns values for all readable DPs (like GET)

name: _system cmd selector (2)
info:
Select GET/SET/SCHEMA/MULTIPLE  commands 
for 'fake' device

Implementation:

"_system":"_trgPing" accepts only GET: fires a data refresh.
             
The stadard GET tuyaDAEMON request
````
    msg.payload:{
        "device":"_system", 
        "property":"_trgPing"  
        } 
````        
fires a flow that implements the command.

name: _system (fake device)
info:
a) Initial configuration: see `*Global SYSTEM config` node. b) EXPECTED OUTPUT at start, in sidebar: ```` 26/4/2023, 10:48:13node: tuyaDAEMON.core.info msg.payload : array[2] [ "RX: HAL@home/_laststart", "2023-04-26 10:48:14" ] ```` b) TEST FLOW Test mini-flows are present for virtually all features. See result in sidebar. ### Troubleshooting ### 1. _After 'Deploy' the module don't send nothing to sidebar log_ 2. _Some tests do not work at all (no log)_ _Cause_: The 'Deploy', after an 'Import', sometime (not clear why) do not set external 'link' nodes. **Important: After 'Import' + 'Deploy' CHECK all external links nodes**.
As help, the name of all Links shows the origin or the destination (e.g.: `from core.'to fake devices'`, `to core.'logging'`) 3. _fake deviceID 'required'_
Doing any DB test, or using `'_system._sqlDBlocal'` or `'_system._sqlDBremote'` you get as response: ```` 0: "ERROR [OUT data]: ADD to alldevices the real/fake deviceId: required (undefined)" 1: object ```` The cause is an null value for 'deviceID' (after an `'import'+'deploy'`) in the `CORE.do logging` subflow near the `CORE.execute on DB local` node.
Set it to `[string] _system`. (credential not required). 4. _SYSTEM STARTUP ERROR: adjust the startup delay_ You need to increment the delay in 'startup delay' node. See [starup process](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#the-tuyadaemon-three-step-startup-process). **GENERAL WARNING**: the `'import'+'Deploy'` does not copy `'credential' parameters`. TuyaDAEMON uses `credential` only in input fields containing `'id'` and `'key'` of Tuya devices (optional).
_So you must check all nodes with the 'credential' option:_ - `tuya-smart-device` node - `do logging`, `do command`, `static retry`, `dynamic retry`, `REFRESH` CORE subflows. note: exception is the `CORE.'*device selector'` node because the `switch` node-red node does not accept `credentials` (see [request77622](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/switch-node-accepts-credentials-in-test-value/77622)) ------------------------------------ 2.2.2 - refactoring some nodes (added 'let', 'const': var declaration) - updated installation istructions 2.2.1: Bug list - Reduced 'power' options to BAT, AC, UPS W - Bad use of 'Max time' in REFRESCH parameter, replaced by 'Max_time' (MUST be a js variable name)

name: Alarms (readme)
info:
SYSTEM Alarms:

See system, `_ACpower`, `_ACunconnected`,  `_LANnet`, `_WIFInet`, `_WIFIunconnected`, `_laststart` DPs.

Checked for any changes in the state of the devices and according to the definition of "power" of the device
(requires some devices to work):

- **AC_ALARM**:      some real devices are 'AC' powered AND  all are unconnected

- **WIFI_ALARM**:    some real devices are not 'BAT' powered AND not AC_ALARM AND all are unconnected

- **LAN_ALARM**:     can not cannect a web site (default: nodered.com).

Only at start:

- **start_DEAMON**:  signals tuyaDAEMON start, after the initial connection activity.
                     User defined delay (defaut 10 s). Example: can be used to do initial UI refresh.

note: user can reduce the Alarm visibility (see [hide](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaDAEMOM-global.alldevices#output-control))  or disable related nodes.

name: SET _tuyastatus ()
info:
This is a SET (it as a value) but really it is a trigger for an action: to 'get tuyastatus data'.
 
  If payload.value.device does NOT exist,
         returns a 'list' of all devices in tuyastatus, using usernames (if defined).
         
  Example:
   
              list: array[3]
                 0: "tuya_bridge"
                 1: "core"
                 2: "HAL@home"
   
   see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: SET tuyastatus ( _system. _laststart )  to a fake value
info:
This command is a SET (because it contains a value) but is actually a trigger for an action: to 'set tuyastatus data'.

     If payload.value.device exists,
     AND there is payload.value.property,
     AND there is payload.value.value:
         this SET the value to 'tuyastatus.device.property'.       
       
  ATTENTION: no checks are made on device, property and value, so it is possible to do anything (good) but it is dangerous, very dangerous: all the logic of tuyaDAMON can be broken (bad) !
  
    Example:
       this example sets a 'fake' value for 'system.laststart'. Check the result with the 'GET _laststart property' test
       
see  https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: GET _tuyastatus ( _core )
info:
This command is a SET (it as a value) but really it is a trigger for an action: to 'get tuyastatus data'.


     If payload.value.device exists,
     and there is NO payload.value.property:   
       it returns a object: a tuyastatus fragment
 
   Example:
       1: object
          device: "core"
          value: object
             schema: object
                _connected: true
                _DBase: true
                _heartbeat: "21:38:51"
                version: "none"
                _t: 1648327133

note: the 'schema' is 'as is' from 'tuyastatus', i.e. also with pseudoDPs (see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#pseudodp), like '_connected'.

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: GET _tuyastatus ( _system . _laststart )
info:
This command is a SET (because it contains a value) but is actually a trigger for an action: to 'get tuyastatus data'.

     If payload.value.device exists,
     AND there is payload.value.property,
     AND there is NO payload.value.value:
       it returns a message (GET) with the value of the tuyastatus.device.property
 
   Example:
       
           device: "HAL@home"
           property: "_laststart"
           
           you get a value like: "2022-03-27 08:58:22"

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: *Global SYSTEM config
info:
**SYSTEM** Configuration User defined values: _beep64_
The audio WAV data used by the `_beep` command is a string coded code64.
see 'Telemachus' node. ### INSTALLATION - **Global.alldevice** Update CORE.`Global.alldevice` adding the `_system` device:
- Add to 'fake' devices the '_system' definitions in the "device__system.json" file. - Customize it adding 2 lines on top (you can change the 'name'): ```` { add> "id": "_system", add> "name": "HAL@home", "device": "_system", ... more ... ```` - **Language**
To change the TTS _Voice/Language_, browser dependent, see SYSTEM.`*Telemachus` node properties.
On my Chrome the choice is: `en/it/es/fr/de/hi/jp/id`. - Some commands require the `'TRIGGER'` module installed to work. Optional: in case of misuse is sent a warning. - The start setup delay (see [starup procvess](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#the-tuyadaemon-three-step-startup-process)) ------------------------------ ### Programmer's notes: - To test the LAN connection, `_system` reads the home page of `http://nodered.com`, and checks for some text: this can change in future, update the 'LAN check' node, const FINDSTRING. - **DataBase** commands: changing the number or use of BDs, it may be necessary to update the `*_system custom selector (3)` node, reserved to DB commands.
See the comment node `CUSTOMIZE: DBase servers (readme)` in 'CORE'. ### Details 1. For users convenice, `system` also present some public node LINK (you can use them in applications): - **start_DAEMON** _fired after the initial delay_. - **AC ALARM**: _sends a msg every change of AC power_. - **WIFI ALARM**: _sends a msg every change of WiFi, if ACpower is true._ - **LAN ALARM**: _sends a msg every change of LAN status_. 2. `_system` is built as an addon: if your application doesn't need those resources, you can disable/delete this flow.

not: doSCHEMA can be used with ANY device, also if device.SCHEMA is not available.     

see https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/custom-device-_system#tuyastatus

name: CORE TRIGGER  extension 2.2.2
info:
a) Initial configuration: see `*Global TRIGGER config` node. b) TEST FLOW Test mini-flows are present for virtually all features. See result in sidebar. ### Troubleshooting ### 1. _After 'Deploy' the module don't send nothing to sidebar log_ 2. _Some tests do not work at all (no log)_ _Cause_: The 'Deploy', after an 'Import', sometime (not clear why) do not set external 'link' nodes. **Important: after 'Import' + 'Deploy' CHECK all external links nodes**.
As help, the name of all Links shows the origin or the destination (e.g.: `from core.'to fake devices'`, `to core.'logging'`) 3. _"[startup] ERROR: not found the device_ '_tuya_bridge' in global.alldevices."_
Verify `alldevices` in `Global CORE config` node, and `TUYABRDG` in `Global TRIGGER config` node. Usually a writing mistake. 4. _TRIGGER STARTUP ERROR: adjust the startup delay_
You need to increment the delay in 'startup delay' node. See [starup process](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#the-tuyadaemon-three-step-startup-process). 5. **GENERAL WARNING**: the `'import'+'Deploy'` does not copy `'credential' parameters`. TuyaDAEMON uses `credential` only in input fields containing `'id'` and `'key'` of Tuya devices (optional).
_So you must check all nodes with the 'credential' option:_ - `tuya-smart-device` node - `do logging`, `do command`, `static retry`, `dynamic retry`, `REFRESH` CORE subflows. 5. _If a 'real' Tuya device refuses the connection at startup_: - double check the [device `id`](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/Howto:-add-a-new-device-to-tuyaDAEMON#1-preconditions). A bad `key` prevents the data from being properly decrypted (see [TuyAPI note 5](https://github.com/codetheweb/tuyapi#-notes)) - wait and be patient: usually a device connects in 1-6 retries - try node-red "Deploy" command - try node-red "Restart flows" command (very effective) - Switch off then switch on the device power. - Restart node-red. - Switch off then switch on the WiFi router power. - Weak signal: consider moving the device or extending the WiFi with a repeater ------------------------------------ 2.2.2 - updated installation istructions

name: test   Tuya_bridge counter  + CORE
