Test some TRIGGER capabilities.

Ruquires core trigger  'Global TRIGGER config' node updated.

name: triggerMAP (readme)
info:
This is hardware depended, and can be modified. 1) HW: I use a TYWR 7-32 switch (see the [wiki](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/tuyaTRIGGER) and the [switch](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/blob/main/devices/switch-1CH/device_switch-1CH.pdf)), - the countdown (`dps = 7`) has a range `0..86400` s (24 H). - the countdown is PUSHed `every 30 s`. - `SET(countdown, 0)` does not change the switch status.

2) >The switch is free and usable by any applications: the TRIGGER uses only the `countdown` function and does NOT interfere with the status of the switch. 3) RULES: - _Tuya limits_: 100 automations for 'home' and 20 'homes' per account, i.e. max. 2000 triggers (see info on [wiki](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/tuyaTRIGGER-info)). - _The problem is that the `countdown` counts anytime, so, if an ACK is missed, the count can TRIGGER the next lower value (interference)_. - If the direction is _Tuya-cloud -> tuyaDAEMON_, the receiver (tuyaDAEMON) MUST send asap an ACK (`SET to 0 the dp 7`). - If the direction is _tuyaDAEMON -> Tuya-cloud_, the related automation MUST, as first action, `set to 0 the countdown`. - In the used tuya_bridge device, the countdown sends every 30s the actual value, as PUSH. This PUSH is used as fallback mechanism to reset the countdown to 0. - So: the receiver MUST send an `ACK` asap, max. 30s. If missed, the fallback (countdown PUSH + code in `ACK and filter` node) resets the conter. - However, interference between two events or commands that are too close together is possible: if necessary, a complete HANDSHAKE protocol can be implemented. >The range 1 - 86400 can be used, for user commands or mirror devices. I use following rules: 4) RULES - All parameters are stored in the `Global TRIGGER Config` node, for easy update. - Assign close values to each device/application but use values _multiple of a fixed amount,_ e.g. `70`s. This gives us a total 1235 triggers and it allows 2 fallback intervents before interference. - Before a critical application (e.g. alarm), to be safe, you can insert an extra guard. - Place commands `TO Tuya-cloud` in the upper range, messages `FROM Tuya-cloud` in the lower range: in case of `tuyaDEAMON` down, cammands are not sended, and the messages from devices, not handled, are without dangerous conseguences. - I keep separate the trigger used for the 'mirror' devices (i.e. devices NOT handled by `node-tuya-smart-device`) and the `user-trigger`, used to do other communications to/from tuya-cloud. ------------------------- ## the trigger MAP for TYWR 7-32 switch (default) | count [s] | Description | |-------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------| | 0 | _This MUST never be reached, because the switch toggles at 0_.
`SET(countdown, 0)` (`ACK`) is allowed, the switch does not toggle. | |         1..1049 | Not used (security gap). | | 1050 | LOWGUARD value, handled by Tuya-cloud (case of tuyaDAEMON shutdown). The management of a guard is entirely entrusted to _Tuya automation_ (add it to SmartLife).
_note: This automation is also used to measure the tuyaDAEMON roundtrip time (see_ `tuya_bridge.trgPing` _property_). | ``` if "tuya_bridge"(countdown1) = 1050, then 0 => "tuya_bridge"(countdown1) ``` | count [s] | Description | |----:|:----------------------------------------------| | 1051..10009 | Reserved (future uses) | | 10010..20019| area for about 130 user-events FROM TUYA (TuyaTRG)| | 20020..29959| area for about 130 user-commands TO TUYA (RedTRG) | 29960 | MIRRORGUARD value (add the Tuya-cloud guard Automation)| ``` if "tuya_bridge"(countdown1) = 29960, then 0 => "tuya_bridge"(countdown1) ``` | count [s] | Description | |----:|:----------------------------------------------| | 30030..50049 | Area for about 270 events FROM TUYA 'mirror' devices | | 50050..70069 | Area for about 270 commands TO TUYA 'mirror' devices | | 70070.. 86500 | Reserved (future uses) | ---------------------------

name: fallback:   SET counter 7000
info:
test fallback 

 _The values used in the counter as TRIGGER are multiple of 70 (flow.COUNTSTEP)._
 _See 'Tuya-bridge MAP (example)' node._
 
 _Normally the receiver, when a TRIGGER arrives, sends an ACK (reset 0) to the counter, to avoid interference with the previous TRIGGER, or worse, the relay toggle if the counter reaches 0._
 
 _To reduce interference, tuyaDAEMON exploits PUSHed values every 30s from the counter to do a fallback auto-reset in case of ACK failure for any reason._
    
 _7000 is multiple of 70, i.e. it can be a TRIGGER: therefore tuyaDEAMON dont auto-sends the ACK. But 7000 is not a defined TRIGGER, so nobody sends the ACK._

 _tuyaDEAMON auto-sends an ACK at next message PUSHed from the device counter not multiple of 700, i.e. 7000-30 = 6970. If 6970 is also missed for any reason, a second chance is at 7000-60 = 6940._
_note: some devices send the countdown when 30*k, i.e. at 6990: same result._

expected result:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ", 7000]  // echo 
  
  after 30s: 
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ", 6970]  // counter PUSH 
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ",0]     // echo auto-ACK

Troubleshooting (more than one tuyaDAEMON instance):
1)  If after:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ", 6970]
  is missed:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ",0]
  Check trigger.global.is_master: one instance must be 'true'.
  
2) After:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ", 6970]
  if you have two tuyaDAEMON instances, you can send two ACK:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ",0]
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ",0]
  Check trigger.global.is_master: only one instance must be 'true' (usually the one 24/7)

name: TRIGGER filter
*Global TRIGGER config
info:
## TRIGGER Configuration VALUES for the [TYWR 7-32](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/blob/main/devices/switch-1CH/device_switch-1CH.pdf) switch. User defined CONSTANTs, see '`Tuya-bridge MAP`' node for details: _COUNTDP_ (7)
the dp for the cunter in tuya_bridge device (see datasheet) _COUNTSTEP_ (70) time between TRIGGERs:
(COUNTSTEP > 2 * delta-count_)
Example: delta-count = 30s => 2* 30 + 10 = **70** i.e. 2 fallback chances before interference. _MIRRORGUARD_ (29960)
Tuya-cloud guard between 'mirror' devices and custom events. Must be COUNTSTEP multiple: (_MIRRORGUARD = COUNTSTEP * n1_), used in Tuya automation. _LOWGUARD_ (1050)
The Tuya-cloud guard low value. Must be COUNTSTEP multiple: (_LOWGUARD = COUNTSTEP * n2_), used in Tuya automation. Configuration: _TUYABRDG_ ('_tuya-bridge')
The name of the used device, as in global.alldevices. _is-master_ true (default)| false
In case of multiple instances using the same 'tuya_bridge' device, only one is the 'master' that does the fallback (auto ACK). _NPING_ (5)
Numbers of pings used by _tstPing capability. -------------------------------- ### INSTALLATION **Preconditions** * TuyaDAEMON CORE, SYSTEM installed and working You MUST have one HW Tuya device (switch): * Identify the counter DP (for the 'TYWR 7-32': dp = 7) * Verify that `SET(counter, 0)` does not change the switch status ON/OFF * Identify the `delta-count`, the count PUSH rate (for the 'TYWR 7-32': 30s) * _Define a `triggerMAP` for your device._ (see `triggerMAP (readme)` node) _If the [device is known](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/tree/main/devices) verify the datasheet, else do some tests to verify preconditions._ Hardware used values: device counter DP: 7 ( in _COUNTDP_) device delta-count: 30 s (used in MAP definitions) step between used values: 70 ( in _COUNTSTEP_) **flow setup**
- Import in node-red the `core_TRIGGER` flow () - Set in `trigger.tuya-smart-device` node the `ID` and `Key` of the actual device. - 'tuya_bridge' must reconnect fast: set both timeout to 500-1000 ms. - Set in `trigger.static-retry node` the `ID` of the actual device. - **Important: After 'Import' + 'Deploy' CHECK all external links nodes**. In CORE, update the '*device selector': '_tuya_bridge' MUST be the first device. **Update the `global.alldevices.real` in '`Global CORE setup`' node:**
Insert the data for the switch used (if not already installed for tests). Then do following updates: - Change the switch device name as in _TUYABRDG_ (default '_tuya-bridge'). - Add (merge) 2 new dPs to the device, from the file `device__trigger.json`. - update also the device-name at line 26! - Pay attention to curly braces and commas when editing the global.alldevices !! - Edit the `switch.countdown` dP used (dp in _COUNTDP_): - name: "trigger (reserved)" - capabilities: "TRG" done. Deploy and try the tests in the 'core_TRIGGER' flow. note: After debugging, in production, it is better to hide all trigger messages: Add "hide"="K" to dp used (_COUNTDP_).

name: *test  SET:  trgPing
info:
Test custom function _tstping

This function does a test of the TRIGGER communication speed. A statistical valutation  of the total tuyaDAEMON -> tuya_bridge -> Tuya-cloud -> automation -> tuya_bridge -> tuyaDAEMON round trip time. 

The timer start sending to tuya_bridge counter the SET(LOWGUARD) command, and stop at ACK (0) echo  from tuya_bridge device.
The test is done flow.NPING times (default 5, a good value) and result shows average, min. and max. values.

Implementation
    This test is implemented as a new custom tuya_bridge property (dp = 100), handled by the code in the core.trigger flow.
    You MUST add this dp (and related friendly name, e.g. 'tstping') to tuya_bridge device in core.global.alldevices.
    
expected result:
   
         [ "TX SET: device 'tuya_bridge'/'", "any" ]            // command sended
         [ "RX: tuya_bridge/_tstPing", "started" ]   // echo 
  
  after 2s delay:
         [ "RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (re", 1050 ]             // echo tuyaDAEMON command
  then     
         [ "RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (re", 0 ]                // echo ACK
         
  repeated NPING times, then:
   
         [ "RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'tstping' ", object ]             // done: result
         
  if I open it (click the triangle) I get like:
         array[2] 
           0: "RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'tstping' "
           1: object
             count: 5      
             avg: 138    (times in ms)
             max: 204
             min: 112

name: *test  GET last  trgPing
info: Standar GET for tstping.

name: fallback:   SET counter 7010
info:
test fallback 

 _The values used in the counter as TRIGGER are multiple of 70 (flow.COUNTSTEP)._
 _See 'Tuya-bridge MAP (example)' node._
 
 _ If the conter is SET (by any way) to a value NOT  multiple of 70  (e.g. 7010) sends an ACK (reset 0) to the counter, to avoid interference with the previous TRIGGER, or worse, the relay toggle if the counter reaches 0._
 

expected result:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ", 7010]  // echo 
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ",0]     // echo auto-ACK

Troubleshooting (more than one tuyaDAEMON instance):
1)  If after:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ", 7010]
  is missed:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ",0]
  Check trigger.global.is_master: one instance must be 'true'.
  
2) After:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ", 7010]
  if you have two tuyaDAEMON instances, you can send two ACK:
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ",0]
      ["RX: 'tuya_bridge'/'trigger (reserved)' ",0]
  Check trigger.global.is_master: only one instance must be 'true' (usually the one 24/7)

CORE MQTT extension  2.2.2
info:
a) Initial configuration: see `*Global MQTT config` node. ### Troubleshooting ### 1. **Important: After 'Import' + 'Deploy' CHECK all external links nodes**.
As help, the name of all Links shows the origin or the destination (e.g.: `from core.'to fake devices'`, `to core.'logging'`) 2. _MQTT STARTUP ERROR: adjust the startup delay_ You need to increment the delay in 'startup delay' node. See [starup process](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/ver.-2.0--milestones#the-tuyadaemon-three-step-startup-process). ------------------------------------ 2.2.2 - updated installation istructions - better topic process for commands

name: Global MQTT config
info:
## MQTT Configuration User defined:
_flow.topic-event_
`tuyaDAEMON/+remote+/+device+/events/+property+` (default) _flow.topic-command_
`tuyaDAEMON/+remote+/+device+/commands/+property+` (default) Topic default architecture: 'tuyaDAEMON///commands/' JSON value 'tuyaDAEMON///events/' and values are always JSON. note: `'+remote+', '+device+', '+property+'` are mandatory placeholders, replaced at runtime. -------------------------- Using the default topic definition you get this structure on _MQTTexplorer_: ```` 192.168.XX.XX\ (server IP) $SYS tuyaDAEMON\ ANDROID\ (remote name) core\ (user device name or deviceID) commands\ ... events\ _heartbeat = "13:29:10" (user dP name or dP, last value) ... HAL@home\ (user device name or deviceID) ... ```` ------------------------------- ### MQTT broker setup - You can use the `aedes broker node` defaults.
- Update the 'MQTT server configuration' in client nodes.
- This module does not require `global.alldevices` updates. ### details - This flow includes a 'MQTT broker' (server) node. Clients nodes and external client (like MQTTexplorer) can connect to this server. - If you like to use an external broker (e.g. _Mosqitto_) disable/delete the 'MQTT broker' node and use node-red 'MQTT server configuration' in client nodes to link the external broker. - In case of many instances you can: - any instance uses own broker. - all instances uses an external MQTT broker (e.g. _Mosquitto_). - only one instace (master: better if 24/7 on) works as broker for all others (slaves): - in slaves disable/delete the 'MQTT broker' node. - in slaves set the 'MQTT server configuration' in client nodes to link the master. - the external clients (like MQTTexplorer) must connect the master. ## Test Use a MQTT Client (e.g. MQTTExplorer) to connect to http://localhost:1883 (default). - See 'CORE test using MQTT (readme)' node.

name: CORE test using MQTT (readme)
info:
All tuyaDEAMON commads and events can be handled via MQTT

Examples:
- test CORE properties using 'MQTTExplorer' (http://mqtt-explorer.com/) as UI client connected to TuyaDAEMON MQTT Broker (usually 'localhost:1883').

Topic: 

general default [structure](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON#mqtt-interface): 

    tuyaDAEMON/<remote_name>/<device_name>|' '/event|command[/<property_name>]

Value (payload):

   always JSON:
       a string        = "string"
       boolean true    = true
       null, undefined = < nothing, clean pad >
     
hit:
   If 'PUBLISH' is without effect, check for extra spaces before or after the topic string (common mistake using copy-paste).
   
More examples can be found in ['github.tuyaDEAMON.tuyaTRIGGER.readme'](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/blob/main/tuyaTRIGGER/README.md#mqtt-tuya_bridge-tests)-

name: TRIGGER and MIRROR DEVICES  (readme) v. 2.2.2
info:
This flow implements all TRIGGER and 'mirror' devices used by tuyaDAEMON. This is just a collection of examples, which each user must customize according to their needs. Having all triggers in one flow helps you see the whole picture and avoids some trivial mistakes, like using the same trigger multiple times. Customization is very simple, taking advantage of some ad hoc subflows. Only in one case ('pick and execute' functions) is it necessary to write code in JScript. note: _depending on the device used, the `smartLife` user interface can vary._ To set the TRIGGER value required: - if allowed, just type the value - or use the slider with a pen to go near the target value (+/- 50)
then use 'up'/'down' to get the exact value. - In some cases, faster to transform the value in HH:mm:ss

name: smoke detector
info:
for my device
dp = 102    // countdown

name: smoke detector: pick and execute
TUYATRG  (MAP:  10010..20019)
info:
Here TRIGGERs from `Tuya` to `node-red` to fire user action on tuyaDAEMON.
**[automation (user|event)] => TUYATRG => [any TuyaDAEMO action]**


The source is Tuya: a `scene` (user action) or an `automation` (event) sets the countdown to the required value.

### EXAMPLE

 -  To test, a scene (tap-to-run) is required on Tuya:
````
     if tap-to-run 
             tuya_bridge countdown: 10010
````
 - Add some nodes to 'TUYATRG10010' link. Enough a DEBUG node. 
 
 - Activating the scene in `smartLife`, a message is shown in `debugPad`.

name: REDTRG  (MAP:   20020..29959)
info:
Here TRIGGERs from `node-red` to `Tuya` to fire user action on Tuya.
**[node-red message] => REDTRG => [any Tuya action (scene)]**

The source is `node-red`: for a test use the 'test REDTRG20020' input node.

Add one automation to Tuya to do the required action.

### EXAMPLE

 -  To test, a simple automation on Tuya:
````
     if tuya_bridge countdown = 20020
             tuya_bridge countdown <= 0    // ACK mandatory
        and  message                       // user action
````
 
  - Activating the input in `tuyaDAEMON`, a message is shown on the phone.

name: MIRROR device 'smoke detector' events (MAP: 30030..50049)
info:
The incoming TUYATRG is converted to `device/property/value` and sent to tuyaDAEMON ('to logging' link) for standard processing.
**[automation(property/value)] => TUYATRG => [tuyaDAEMON message] => [CORE]** ### EXAMPLE This implementation is done following the [mirror device 'Smoke_Detector': case study](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/mirror-device-'Smoke_Detector':-case-study) 1. _Seven Tuya automation_ are required to generate all **TUYATRGs**. 2. A `switch` node selects the TRIGGERs using the `payload.tuyatrigger` value in the incoming node-red message. 3. A subflow `do logging` builds the standard TuyaDEAMON device message `remote/device/property/value` for the CORE process.

name: MIRROR device 'smoke detector' commands  (MAP:  50050..70069)
info:
The incoming Tuya command (`device/property/value`) is converted to TRIGGER and sent to tuya_bridge.
**[message] => REDTRG => [automation] => property/value** ### EXAMPLE This implementation is done following the [mirror device 'Smoke_Detector': case study](https://github.com/msillano/tuyaDAEMON/wiki/mirror-device-'Smoke_Detector':-case-study) 1. A `pick and execute` node selects the TRIGGER using the `property` and `value` of the incoming tuyaDEAMON message. 2. A subflow `REDTRG` builds the correct command for `tuya_bridge`. 3. In Tuya an automation sends the ACK and then set the required `property` at the right `value`.
